Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Beaverton School District had the highest number of homeless students ever recorded in Oregon, when in fact, previous years had higher numbers.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to support the statement that Beaverton School District had the highest number of homeless students ever recorded in Oregon.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation provided in the expert's verdict, which suggests that the previous year's figures show that other school districts had higher numbers of homeless students than Beaverton School District.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by not accurately representing the data and rankings of homeless students in different school districts in Oregon.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the highest number of homeless students in Beaverton School District means it is the highest ever recorded in Oregon, without considering previous years' data.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Beaverton School District had the highest number of homeless students ever recorded in Oregon, as previous years had higher numbers in other school districts.
